paper_abstract: We exhibit a quantum algorithm for determining the zeta function of a genus g curve over a finite field Fq, which is polynomial in g and log(q). This amounts to giving an algorithm to produce provably random elements of the class group of a curve, plus a recipe for recovering a Weil polynomial from enough of its cyclic resultants. The latter effectivizes a result of Fried in a restricted setting.
paper_title: Quantum computation of zeta functions of curves
